turns.text: Uh what i- what is your practice as far as budgeting Do you manage the money
turns.label: qo

turns.text: Well I we talk about it but Im usually the one that sits down and puts the pencil to the paper and and tries to somehow make the ends meet which uh -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh I see Thats how kind of I am too Are you married
turns.label: bk

turns.text: Um yes
turns.label: ny

turns.text: You are
turns.label: bf

turns.text: Yes
turns.label: aa

turns.text: I think the women for the most part end up managing the money My husband always says he earns it and I have to spend only what he earns It -
turns.label: sv

turns.text: I dont mind the spending its just that trying to trying to get what you need out of out of what you have That seems to be our challenge
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well I dont work outside of the home and he always threatens that when I spend more than whats coming in I have to go back to work --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I see
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- so I I manage it
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well Im Im at home also so it does get rather interesting trying to survive on one salary uh
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Now do you actually follow budget
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Well we pretty well do Um several years we didnt and we found that we just werent making the most of what we had and so we we um set aside certain amount each week that goes for things that have to be paid for you know just our bills And then whats left we divvy up We try to save little bit although were not always successful and then the rest of it just goes for normal weekly needs
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well thats pretty much the way we do um or we did in the past I would say Uh - at this point our children are grown and so I really dont have the obligations there any more --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- that we have to balance to --
Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- you know get things together for them and I really just keep very good records and most of our expenses are fairly the same every month with the exception of utilities and things like that and --
Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- I try to keep my MasterCards and things paid currently --
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- uh I dont always succeed at that I usually keep one with low interest rate and I put things on there that I think Im not going to get to --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- and then I have another one but for the most part our mortgage and our utilities at this point were in new home and uh they take pretty big chunk compared to what they used to --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- so Im still getting used to that but we make sure that we just do not buy unless we really can see how were going to pay for it ahead --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- and we do not buy us new cars Uh do you get into car -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well we had new cars um always until about four years ago my husband um owned his own company and it went under and so we could no longer afford that monthly payment and now it just seems just such large amount of money to spend that that we do have used car well he has company car also but for our personal car we have used car Um do you think that its wiser to buy used
turns.label: na

turns.text: We do for us very much so In fact we are in position that most of our friends why wonder why we just dont go to new car you know whatever and I said --
turns.label: na

turns.text: Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- look you guys are all into car payments we havent had car payments for so many years I love it this way and recently we just created the laugh among everyone because we had car that we really liked and it has eighty-two thousand miles on it --
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- and we were kept saying wouldnt it be great if we could find another one just like it Believe it or not we did we found one one newer --
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: Oh no
turns.label: ba

turns.text: -- the worst part is its the same color --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- and so everybodys saying youre kidding you have two cars the same and I said you know how when you have bad one you say never again --
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: Thats right
turns.label: ba

turns.text: -- I said well we had one and we found one with just seventeen thousand miles on it --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Wow
turns.label: ba

turns.text: -- and its an eighty-five and so I said Hey this was cinch we paid for the car and we still know now that we have this car to put all the miles on
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: This is for all the long running back and forth on you know interstate driving and things and we intend to replace our other one with much newer car in the next couple of years or next year probably
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Do you um buy from dealers or from individuals
turns.label: qr

turns.text: Generally from dealers and uh it depends because I dont like to sell what were trading in to an individual --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- uh unless we we have done that when we had really good one that we wanted to sell --
Right
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- you know we were going up to larger one but we have found that by trading in and going through dealer and we always make deal I mean we have walked out of more dealerships saying dont bring us the manager and all of that unless you want to bring him right away Youre going to get one shot at us --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- we will you know - and they say Well youre kidding you know I - - no this is the price were going to give you out the door We dont want to hear about taxes
turns.label: sd
